snippet: The Department of Homeland Security ordered changes after finding that Azamat Tazhayakov, a friend of the surviving suspect in the Boston bombings, used a visa that should have been canceled.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security orders new security checks for all foreign students entering United States; move is prompted by discovery that Azamat Tazhayakov, friend of Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, had left and returned to US using student visa that should have been cancelled.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Homeland Security ordered changes after finding that Azamat Tazhayakov, a friend of the surviving suspect in the Boston bombings, used a visa that should have been canceled.

headline.seo: Foreign Students Will Face New Checks When Entering United States
headline.main: Foreign Students to Face New Checks at U.S. Borders
headline.print_headline: After Bombing Arrest, Foreign Students Will Face New Checks at Borders
